website_summaries.verdict: The ability to store and transport a miter saw on this stand makes it a top choice for those looking for convenience.
pros: Convenient rolling stand makes it easier to move miter saw around job sites
Initial assembly is simple and stand is very sturdy
Saw mounts securely and can be easily detached
cons: Stand plus saw can rise uncomfortably high for some users

customer_reviews.title: Great idea and it works
customer_reviews.text: Great idea and it works. If there's an unfortunate, it came without operating or installation manual. I spread it out on the garage floor looked at the picture and put it together. When assembling note that there are 17mm bolts with locking nuts that should not be tightened/torgued down as those joints swivel to allow the cart to fold and unfold Conclusion: you want something compact that works, this is the one
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: I love it! Seems to be built and engineered very well. It was a bit scary to use for the first time - your looking at that $600 saw tilting vertcally. But it is very - very convenient - in all of it's aspects. For me worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: WGL - Bellingham WA

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE AND NO CUSTOMER SUPPORT!
customer_reviews.text: I BOUGHT THIS SAW STAND IN SEPTEMBER OF 2019. HAD IT FOR 8 MONTHS AND IT BROKE AT THE BOTTOM WHERE THE LEVELING ADJUSTMENT SCREWS TOUCH THE GROUND. ONE SIDE COMPLETED BROKE IN HALF AND THE SECOND IS READY TO BREAK. I TRIED TO CALL BOSCH AND GOT THE RUN AROUND FROM THE CUSTOMER SERVICE. THE LADY ON THE PHONE DID NOT EVEN KNOW WHAT I WAS TALKING ABOUT. PUT ME ON HOLD, THEN I WAS CUT OFF AFTER ANOTHER 20 MINUTES ON HOLD. SORRY BOSCH BUT I AM OUT 400.00 AND YOUR SUPPORT IS TERRIBLE. MY REVIEW OF PRODUCT IS "IT IS GARBAGE! ESPECIALLY IF YOU ACTUALLY USE IT".
customer_reviews.author: George H.

customer_reviews.title: Might not fit your saw
customer_reviews.text: While a nice stand it doesn't have much flexibility to deal with anything other than a square base. My saw's ( a good Hitachi) front mounting holes are 3.5 inches & 4.5 inches from the back vertical plane. The back mounting nuts have plenty of leeway but the front two don't. The saw will not mount square to the workpiece plane with all 4 mounting holes. I had to leave the front right bolt empty. There was just enough room to put a clamp on the base at that point. It's a good stand, just make sure your mounting base is pretty much square.
customer_reviews.author: WarEagleDan

customer_reviews.title: Great stand, don’t need to look at any other one
customer_reviews.text: Great stand; love the way it folds up easily with the saw still attached and lets you wheel it around. As long as you follow the instructions in order, it goes together with only a little trouble. My issues were my fat fingers in trying to attach small nuts in channels to bolts pushed through the other side, and then trying to find the right wrench to hold the bolt to keep if from turning when tightening it.
customer_reviews.author: Bilbo

customer_reviews.title: TOTALLY Worth the Money!
customer_reviews.text: I know what you're thinking. Why is this thing so gosh dang expensive? I am probably the cheapest person ever. For example, I have 20 year old socks that are still perfectly good (even if they're not). This stand is a most-have item for any woodworker whether you're a beginner of job-site professional. It really makes things so easy. You are able to wheel your saw where ever, unfold it, and start cutting. I have two of these stands. One for a 12 inch Craftsman saw (big jobs) and another for a 10 inch Makita (detail work). Don't be fooled by cheaper stands that look similar. This one is much, MUCH better. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, buy it elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: Missing hardware, partially assembled, no instructions, resealed box. I have no doubt this is a good product, do yourself a favor and pay the extra 25 bucks and buy it at Home Depot or Lowe’s.
customer_reviews.author: Terry P.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Parts support
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but original pneumatic tires got old and starting leaking. Normally, garden tires like these are 5 bucks or so, but Borsch has no replacement available because at some point they substituted solid (non-pneumatic) tires on newly sold units. The catch is you have to buy new solid tire with wheels @ $30 a pop- 60 bucks for the whole set, and throw the old one away. Tha wasteful, and 20% of the price for an entire new stand. Bosch is supposed to be a premium producer, so it should have better product support especially considering the original design was defective.
customer_reviews.author: K. C. Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Simply the Best
customer_reviews.text: I've already been a fan of Bosch tools, as they have been the most reliable for me personally. I bought their compound miter saw a while back and got tired of lugging the heavy tool around and putting on saw horses etc. I've been looking at this stand, but didn't want to pay full price. Finally it came up on Amazon for about 70 dollars less than normal through a 3rd party with free shipping. I couldn't wait any longer. After receiving it And setting it up, I determined I probably would have paid full price for it if I used it everyday like a contractor might. The ease of transport and build quality are really superb.
customer_reviews.author: deathscripture

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality. Great features
customer_reviews.text: The stand coupled with the bosch 12 inch miter comes to what I feel like is a vulnerable height. Instead of cutting over top of saw, the cutting is happening at chest height. My arm is out in front of me when cutting which isnt comfortable and I don’t feel I have the control over the saw at that height. I am 5’ 10”. Maybe because I’ve been cutting all my life from sawhorses this height doesn’t feel natural. Still giving this 3 stars; the quality is actually five star but without the height adjustment just doesn’t work for me
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: GREAT once you have put it together. Read more....
customer_reviews.text: Once assembled it's sturdy, easy to set up and collapse. Using it with a 12" DeWalt . rock steady. But putting it together isn't a picnic. 35 minutes to unpack the pieces and check the packing list. Like a lot of others have reported, some small parts like nuts, bolts and washers were missing from the package. So add a bit of shopping time to that 35 minutes. The assembly instructions are clear enough if you have just a little self-assembly experience and a few wrenches. Takes another 45 minutes. Once you have it together it's fabulous to use but I do have to question the price tag for a bunch of steel tubing. Still, a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: K.T. Portland

customer_reviews.title: Good stand - poor packaging - no Manual!
customer_reviews.text: Just got my Bosch miter saw stand. When it arrived by UPS the box was in terrible shape. As I moved it into my garage, the box finally split open and the parts started falling out. Next day I when to assemble the stand and found that there was NO manual. Lucky for the internet as I found it on-line. So after downloading and printing the manual I was able to begin assembly. First I identified that I did in fact have all the parts. Stand is now assembled and my Bosch miter fits nice! Works great. Would have given 5 stars had it not been for the poor packaging and lack of a manual.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Theotonio

customer_reviews.title: A Great Addition to Your Miter Saw for Portability!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing addition to our shop. We have our Dewalt miter saw mounted to this and it allows us to move the saw around to the job site or area effortlessly. It is solid construction, but you must assemble it. Once it together you will be amazed at its ruggedness and portability. Good solid tires allow you to move it over unstable terrain. The gravity lift feature aids in positioning the tool for work. You can work on long pieces of wood with the extendable supports, etc. no wonder it gets solid reviews and recommendations on this and other sites.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Moody

customer_reviews.title: This stand works great. Holds my Dewalt DW716 12" Miter saw perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Just as advertized. This stand works great. Holds my Dewalt DW716 12" Miter saw perfectly. I'm amazed every time I place the stand up to store, or move and that sideways hanging miter saw just acts like it's part of the Stand. Heavy duty. Not too hard putting together. I used a great you tube for the process. The one I used was excellent. Short and sweet, to the point, and being able to view how parts were "facing" made a big difference. I love it, and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MOWAGG

customer_reviews.title: High quality saw stand
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace an older stand for a Bosch compound miter saw. Pros: Well made, sturdy saw stand. Easy to set up and take down. Maneuvering the saw when in stowed position is a breeze. When in work position extensions function as expected and retract/extend smoothly into the stand body. Cons: No written instructions. Picked up a copy off the Bosch website but this sounds like a recurring issue. Box was tattered and falling apart when delivered but, amazingly, everything inside was fine.
customer_reviews.author: TTT

customer_reviews.title: Some SERIOUS engineering here!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. Before I start, the PNE thing I’d caution users about is the tendency to slam it closed when tilting down. PUT YOUR FOOT ON THE AXEL AND LEAN BACK A BIT TO CONTROL THE FOLDING SPEED. I have a 12” Hitachi saw on it, and it’s a big heavy beast. This stand handles it flawlessly, except for folding. It can slam down if you’re not prepared. But: the way this ting makes the tool so mobile so easily, folds out so smoothly, and extends out to support so well if marvelous! Worth it. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Lek

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of not having a real saw stand. Hesitated to spend the money, but I figure this will last me a very long time. Easy to put together. Very sturdy. Primarily using it with a Makita 12" cordless miter saw. Supports it just fine. Combination is not compact at all, but too bad. I have room in my garage and it is really nice to just wheel it out, pop it up, and it's ready to go!
customer_reviews.author: Eric J. Kindle

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this for my husband.
customer_reviews.text: Everyone who sees this in operation says "I want that". It functions as described and is made of sturdy stuff. Ok, I really got it for myself because, now that I am retired, I have more time to play and less hand strength, especially in my left thumb which pretty much louses up your whole hand. My back and knees thank me big time as well. But, you don't have to be an old lady to benefit from this sturdy, steady, easy to stow, easy to move, with great long stock supporting arms miter saw platform. My husband loves it too.
customer_reviews.author: Frugal Female

customer_reviews.title: Fits Makita LS1216L 12
customer_reviews.text: I have to say these reviews really pay off. The stand that is offered for my makita saw is night and day compared to this Bosch T4B. I’m very impressed with the construction of this stand very sturdy and strong. Mounting the Makita do require 2 8mm 1.25 x 60 SHCS ( socket head cap screws) but that is all I needed. You can pick those up at one the box stores. Suggest mounting the brackets to the saw before trying to clamp the saw into the stand.
customer_reviews.author: Razor

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: Great piece of equipment, no bolts/screws or instructions. We are talking about a moderately difficult assembly here. Called the distributor and was told to buy bolts at the local hardware or send it back if I wanted to. I live 40 minutes to the closest town of any size. Seller was indifferent and lucky I haven't taken all the stars away. No fault of the equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: This is a must own add-on for the Bosch saw.
customer_reviews.text: Construction is easy but time consuming. You'll need some tools not included but nothing fancy. Sockets, adjustable crescent wrench, your covered. This is a game changer to how you'd utilize the full size mitersaw it's designed for. Really a must own if you have the miter in question.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: It’s the best stand I have used, but heavy.
customer_reviews.text: This stand is amazing but it’s heavy. I have used other miter stands from Rigid and Dewalt and this stand is a Cadillac in a field of clunkers. I find new options every day. It is super adjustable and well balanced but the whole setup with the Bosch compound miter is HEAVY. It’s a 2 person lift if you need to. I would reccomend this stand over all the rest even that overpriced Festool junk.
customer_reviews.author: torsten palm

customer_reviews.title: Love my new wheels!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great way to move your glide saw around. The saw is heavy and this mount is very sturdy. There are times I hesitated using my previous saw because it was such a hassle moving it in and out of my garage. With this gravity rise, I actually look forward to using my miter saw. I have to say, it stands taller than I thought when it is folded. It will not fit into my SUV without taking the saw off. Then I have to reassemble it. Not a major problem, just unexpected. All in all, I'm really loving this! You will too.
customer_reviews.author: DPDUB

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy but....
customer_reviews.text: This stand is super sturdy, however, the extension arms do not extend very far, making it difficult to cut long pieces of wood. The never inflate tires are great! and the unit works very well... But for the money I think I would stick with my Ridgid folding stand that I have on my other setup. Less expensive, lighter, longer arms and a convenient tray for holding pencils or whatever.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Quick fix
customer_reviews.text: I had some problems at the beginning where something wasn't taped. I took it one of the Bosch service center and withing a 3 hours it was fixed, problem solved. I put the parts together and everything is just great. I had looked at other Miter stand and none compared to the quality of this one. I have using it for a while now and it great
customer_reviews.author: JanF7

customer_reviews.title: Assembly Tip
customer_reviews.text: When you are working on step 5, Attach Rail Assembly - Put the nuts from each of the 8 bolts in the closed end of a box end metric wrench and push 1-2 flat toothpicks between the nut and the wrench to hold the nut in the wrench. Then break off the toothpicks so they aren't in the way. This will make it possible to get the nut started on the end of the bolt in the rail assembly. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to miter saw
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, easy to get miter saw attached (I have Bosch GCM12SD), works great for moving the saw out of garage to work area. My only complaint is if the wheels were a little bigger in diameter I might also be able to use it to pull saw in and out of basement through bilco doors. Highly recommended if you need to move your saw. I didn't need it until starting a deck as my saw was typically on stationary bench in basement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was not disappointed. I'm in my 60's and have quality tools
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the review for stands, I chose to spend the extra money for the Bosch. I was not disappointed. I'm in my 60's and have quality tools. I like things that make working with heavy tools easier and with tools that do what they are supposed to do. This stand meets both those criteria. I haven't owned any of the other brand stands, so it is hard for me to compare the T4B to others, but I am very pleased with this one. Like some of the other comments, the extensions sag when fully extended; if that is a critical, then making a couple of supports out of 2x4s would be an easy solution.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great stand.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the design and ease of use. The only concern was the weight of the box made me think it would be difficult to load the saw and unit into my truck. The unit is much lighter than the received package but still very sturdy. The saw is easily removed from the stand which makes lifting each into the truck much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Highest praises for this rig, works like a dream handles my 12” double compound Dewalt miter saw easily, the assembly was easy, I used a engine assembly lubricant from auto zone, very satisfied works like a champ!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lyle A. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy in the Wrong Places
customer_reviews.text: The overall design is very good. However, the telescopic tubes that provide support for long work-pieces is somewhat shoddy. I thought that I could use the outlying rests for stops but the construction is too flimsy. I would recommend the stand if the supports at ends were less flimsy and they could be used as stops for accurately making repeated cuts to length.
customer_reviews.author: Comments

customer_reviews.title: Well made, versatile stand
customer_reviews.text: This stand is a beast. Nice design, holds my very heavy Bosch 12” miter saw with ease. I need to move stationary tools around my shop depending upon the current project and this stand does not let me down. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: I'll just echo that I liked the first one so much (I put a Makita ...
customer_reviews.text: There are plenty of reviews about this stand, so I'm not going to repeat them. I'll just echo that I liked the first one so much (I put a Makita LS1216L 12-Inch Dual Slide Compound Miter Saw on it) that I bought a second one with an extra set of clamp-on rails. I'm getting ready to mount a Makita 2012NB 12-Inch Planer onto one set of the rails.
customer_reviews.author: Chief Cynic In Charge

customer_reviews.title: Nicely Made, Smooth Operation, Easy to Set-up and Store.
customer_reviews.text: Completely solves the setup time/effort that I had with another saw stand. This one stores easily, and sets up easy. Just the flip of a lever and a little tug, and it folds down in a nice controlled motion. And when done with the saw, it folds up nicely and easily, and then I wheel it to its storage place. The only reason for not a full five stars is because the extension arms are a little on the short side. Overall, though, a real solid product, that I would heartily recommend.
customer_reviews.author: RNC

customer_reviews.title: Great saw stand
customer_reviews.text: Hands down this is the best item saw stand out there. Great quality and engineering is excellent. Be advised that assembly is demanding - lots of parts and the order is critical. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Ss
customer_reviews.text: I use it to cut moldings on it , not happy
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: I have used this stand for 4 months on a remodel. I'm not sure why I waited this long to buy it! Super easy to use and the quality of the construction appears excellent. Highly recommend, don't wait!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Just when I thought he had every tool ...
customer_reviews.text: well ... he practically does ... but he didn't have this perfect accessory!!! My husband LOVES this thing and was testing it out within an hour of unwrapping the giant box I wraoped up for him. ... Side note: I LOVE this as there's really no need for me to drop what I am doing to come outside and hold (or "catch") cut 2x4's from falling off sawhorses or anything. THIS IS A TOTAL WIN FOR BOTH OF US!! LOL
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: I already have the Bosch table saw with this type ...
customer_reviews.text: I already have the Bosch table saw with this type of stand, so I knew it works well. Much more compact storage than with my old stand. My onl;y complaint is its a might bit low- I'm stall.Expensive, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: TEM

customer_reviews.title: Great Miter Stand
customer_reviews.text: This is a well constructed miter saw stand, easy to setup and especially easy to move around with the saw! It was pricey but I love it! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stand appears to be great.  Delivery condition is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: The product appears to be well designed and high quality. Unfortunately, the stand was delivered in a wet box that was open. The fasteners and one piece fell on to the driveway before driver reached my porch. I waited about a week for the delivery, had to return to UPS, and will need to wait about a week to get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: David Martin

customer_reviews.title: Re-packaged Return?
customer_reviews.text: The box in which the stand arrived had been opened previously. The instruction manual was missing, but I was able to locate one on the web. I just started assembling it. Fingers crossed, no parts are missing.
customer_reviews.author: EssexB

customer_reviews.title: (not best directions), but once it together
customer_reviews.text: Little tough to put together, (not best directions), but once it together, rock solid. extending the rails is easy, easy to adjust the saw, moving it around so much easier than trying to lug around the saw on it's own (almost impossible - I used my Dewalt compound miter saw more before I bought this with the Bosch sliding compound saw. Added the laser light to the saw blade, really helps the efficiency of the cuts.
customer_reviews.author: William Ziska

customer_reviews.title: Box of parts. No instructions at all. They forgot to pack them
customer_reviews.text: Box of parts. No instructions. Evidently, they forgot to pack the instructions. Parts Looks sturdy. I’m going to look on internet for instructions. After putting together, the stand is great. Solid. Making identical with cuts was easy due to the adjustable stops
customer_reviews.author: q

customer_reviews.title: A must have for your Bosch Saw!
customer_reviews.text: I have the matching table saw and the Gravity Rise stand is the greatest thing since sliced bread. When the pair of saws are folded they don't take up much room. You can set them up in seconds. Ignore the comments about the tires going flat, Bosch switched to solid tires a couple of years ago. These are not cheap, but they are well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph T. Katt

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but great product
customer_reviews.text: Do not like spending money on such products. After checking out the other types of stands (particularly those at the big boxes), I decided upon this one because the other reviews said it was sturdy and well worth the money. It is quite sturdy and a great design. It is easy to maneuver, although a bit bulky in small spaces. It is absolutely fantastic moving around the yard and up and down. I also really like the features it offers like the rails and the quick release mounts. It you are going to purchase one, this is the one I would spend the money on.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Stand
customer_reviews.text: This stand is rock solid and super heavy duty. Pretty sure it could hold my truck up. It is heavy though, aint bringing it 3 flights of stairs. Easy and quick setup.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Cartier

customer_reviews.title: Plain and simple. There is no better miter saw stand.
customer_reviews.text: Plain and simple. There is no better miter saw stand. I have a heavy 10 inch compound sliding miter saw mounted on this stand it is balanced perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: ToolBoxHero

customer_reviews.title: But still a good stand that should cost $50-75 less for what you ...
customer_reviews.text: A bit awkward to raise and lower since the wheels move opposite you'd expect. A little flexible while standing compared to my previous dewalt stand . But still a good stand that should cost $50-75 less for what you get...
customer_reviews.author: Edwin M.

customer_reviews.title: a good stand, but
customer_reviews.text: one of the more expensive stands, but it's well built. however, it did not have 8-Inch pneumatic wheels as advertise.
customer_reviews.author: chuck

customer_reviews.title: Built like a tank
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best stands I’ve used as far as durability and rigidity is concerned. This is an excellent setup for long term projects, jobs, or for people who don’t want a permanent miter saw station. I don’t feel like it’s ideal for small foot print storage or transport. It is heavy and bulky in moving around, but for my needs I wouldn’t trade it for any other on the market
customer_reviews.author: matthew r drinnon

customer_reviews.title: ... had the Dewalt stand and this one is far superior in engineering and durability
customer_reviews.text: I previously had the Dewalt stand and this one is far superior in engineering and durability.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Very Well Made!!
customer_reviews.text: This stand is amazing!! Very well made!! The only downfall of that is the weight. It's an awkward heavy so getting it into a pickup truck is not very easy and that's with the saw not attached. It's a big stand so it takes up a fair amount of storage space and it's 28" wide so it's also difficult getting it through certain doorways if you plan on storing it in a basement. Ended up having to store it in my garage because of this instead of my basement. But it's well worth the small hassles.
customer_reviews.author: max

customer_reviews.title: Go For It Worth The Expense
customer_reviews.text: Great miter saw stand! Fit my 12” Delta Cruzer miter saw perfectly and very stable. The extension arms are great too and they are much more stable than my old Delta stand.
customer_reviews.author: Weekend Warrior

customer_reviews.title: you cannot beat the quality of this product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble . excellent machining and fit on all parts but the assembly directions were missing from package . I don't understand the review that it was difficult to assemble . directions were clear and precise . Directions off the web had different parts then actual . Must have been a old direction . Did not receive any warranty or use directions
customer_reviews.author: yazbik

customer_reviews.title: Great stand, easy to use and transport
customer_reviews.text: A tight shop I needed a stand for a Bosch maitre saw so I could easily move around the shop safely. This was easy to assemble and get the saw on, folds nicely and easy to transport. Wi am now in a larger shop and have considered building a larger mitre stand with more features but love being able to move it out of the way and accommodate long pieces without taking up too much room. Very sturdy, well built and would definitely recommend this
customer_reviews.author: cityToCountry

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Very good for cutting long or short boards. Stable. Easy to move around.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: and it is very easy to store and transport
customer_reviews.text: The Bosch TB4 saw stand makes using the Bosch GCM12SD Miter saw a breeze, and it is very easy to store and transport. I put it to use the first day I received it, on a custom project. It significantly cut down on set-up and break-down time and made it much easier to cut long boards with the arm extensions. I was able to rig a stopper block onto one of the arm extensions to accurately cut repeated length boards. Very happy with the stand!
customer_reviews.author: Barefoot

customer_reviews.title: Great stand but difficult to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: I like the stand and it works great. But it was very difficult to put together. Plan on it taking a few hours if doing it alone
customer_reviews.author: Jay9

customer_reviews.title: Pricy, but worth it to an old guy!
customer_reviews.text: Once you get the hang of it, it is terrific. Can now move my saw to where I am working!
customer_reviews.author: TTownUser

customer_reviews.title: Great company and good product
customer_reviews.text: The box arrived with a rip and a couple of pieces on the ground --nothing was damaged but the assembly package (mostly bolts) was missing. Called Bosch and they shipped out the missing parts in one day--I was impressed. The stand is great, works well to store and move the saw, and easy to setup for someone like me with a bad back.
customer_reviews.author: William Brunkan

customer_reviews.title: Mobility and space saver are great.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Some of the nuts are a pain to get into the track to screw into but everything else went together easy. There was no instruction book in my box so I had to find one online.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Best Stand EVA
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a non-mobile miter saw stand from Ryobi, of which I made a very simple 2x4 base with casters. I used this base to move the miter saw around the shop for the longest time. But it took up SOOO much space, I needed something I could collapse down and move over rocky areas. This fit the bill perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Drofnas

customer_reviews.title: Get This Now
customer_reviews.text: The action on this is effortless. Somehow Bosch has figured out the perfect balance. If feels like you're holding back the weight in both directions. How does it fall up and down, amazing. The assembly left a little to be desired but once its all together, wow. I'll break this puppy out for one cut. It's really that easy.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Grillman

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable engineering
customer_reviews.text: This stand is just plain awesome. It took me a few hours to put it together. The directions are perhaps a little to simple - more detailed diagrams would be nice. However if you take your time all is good. It is unbelievable that you can raise a 150 lbs of material one handed with such ease. Yes, I know its just physics, but the action is so smooth and satisfying. I put my Dewalt miter saw on there without any issue. Perfect height. I highly recommend it. This stand will out last me for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Jason B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Miter Saw Stand
customer_reviews.text: Nice saw stand for my 4410 sliding compound miter saw. Assembly is straight forward if you read & follow the well written directions. Every time I 'jumped ahead' thinking I knew the next step I was wrong. In use it performs as described by Bosch. It is easy to take up and down allowing me to move the saw whenever and wherever I want.
customer_reviews.author: Gord O

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this. It came in, we picked it up from UPS, put it together, and love it. This is a very sturdy easy to use miter saw stand. My only complaint is that just after I paid full price for it, his dad called and said he found one that was half off! Oh well, it was worth every dollar. This is not pneumatic lift, but it is very easy to use. And really, the way it is built, it doesn't need pneumatic lift. Thanks. TJ
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Stand
customer_reviews.text: Received the stand, and unpacked it. All the parts were there. Noticed an allen wrench screw and washer (factory installed) that had dropped off a support bracket while I was assembling it, but easily tightened it back in. The only weird thing was after I had it built, another piece dropped off. It is a broken black washer, cracked in half, from somewhere else inside (a factory one, it's black). The unit works well, and I'm sure (I hope) it is a minor glitch. I'll find it and replace the washer eventually. Once again, the unit works just as it should, and it is really easy to fold up and move around. I like it!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Devico

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: The stand works great. I would have given it 5 stars except for 2 things. First, it came with no setup (or any other kind) of instructions. Second, when I tried to register the stand with Bosch, it wouldn't recognize it
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Buy this tool!
customer_reviews.text: Buy this. I held back for about a year before I purchased. What a mistake. This makes work so easy. I have the 12 inch glide. One heavy bitch, but very easy to move about and set up with the stand. As advertised, it handles 16 foot pieces. Bad part; I hate putting it together.
customer_reviews.author: Paul.

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had purchased this a few years ago when I bought my miter saw. I’m now able to move the miter saw around the house and yard easily for my home projects.
customer_reviews.author: jiri g sisak

customer_reviews.title: Incredible design! No more lifting miter saw out of ...
customer_reviews.text: Incredible design! No more lifting miter saw out of truck or trailer by hand. No more building stands and tables for bump blocks. Unlike other mother saw stands, the stops on this one are durable and do not flex, giving you confidence in every cut!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Yama

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing stand. Its so versatile
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing stand. Its so versatile. Easy to set up. Very solid. Worth the money if you are serious about your tools.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan E Healy

customer_reviews.title: great product. Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: great product. Easy to assemble, makes using the saw a breeze. I attached a Dewalt DWS780 and it works great
customer_reviews.author: dj

customer_reviews.title: Great engineering
customer_reviews.text: Best engineered stand on the market. I have used Makita, Dewalt, Ridgid this stand has them all beat
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bosch Saw Table
customer_reviews.text: The table is exactly what I wanted and came very quickly. It was a little challenge to assemble it, but once we laid out the pieces to match what was on the enclosed instructions, it went very well. It is a very solid table. It folds perfectly out of the way. I am VERY happy with my purchase. The quality and service are top notch.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Better than sliced bread!
customer_reviews.text: I grieved over buying this for a year. Have my portable Bosch table saw on one. This makes life so much easier and you have total lumber support up to 18 feet. Also has built in stops. I hate to measure.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas R. Harwood

customer_reviews.title: you will not find a better stand
customer_reviews.text: I have a dewalt miter saw stand with no wheels and it is better for longer boards but for portability this stand is amazing. I have a delta too which cost less but the extensions are a problem for height adjustment at different extension settings... not the case with this stand as extensions stay level with cutting surface no matter how far you extend them.
customer_reviews.author: The carpenter

customer_reviews.title: This is a great miter saw stand
customer_reviews.text: This is a great miter saw stand. It folds and sets up very easy and makes it much easier for me to move my 12" Makita slider around and stores in a small footprint. It was easy to set up and my saw fit just right, no modifications needed. Just what I wanted!
customer_reviews.author: Retired Dan

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market by a million
customer_reviews.text: Best on the market by a million. Only draw back is that it's heavy as hell, but if you heavy duty, then you but this. I would recommend this to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Paul H.

customer_reviews.title: works well. Enables me to create a mobile shop ...
customer_reviews.text: works well. Enables me to create a mobile shop. Takes a while to figure out how to work it but works well in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Selmer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe I didn't own this sooner. Damn near required accessory.
customer_reviews.author: Simon S

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: makes the moving of my GCM 12SD very easy but it ain't cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Bongo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: This has made life easier. Great addition to my tool collection as it helps with mobility in any situation.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel H.

customer_reviews.title: expensive but I love it, easy to put up to use and ...
customer_reviews.text: expensive but I love it,easy to put up to use and easy to fold away
customer_reviews.author: elew

customer_reviews.title: 25 year carpenter
customer_reviews.text: Best money I've spent. Carpenter for 25 years and I hate lifting anything I don't have to. To the guys who say it heavy.... It's got wheels! I roll it to my van, put the Handel on bed lift and slide. Thank you Bosch
customer_reviews.author: Mikey Z

customer_reviews.title: bosch t4b miter saw stand
customer_reviews.text: This makes woodworking so much easier. I was looking for a folding miter saw table with decent extensions and had stops. This one fit the bill. Very well built. Easy to fold and set up. I paid less on Amazon for this than what the competitors in town were charging. A couple of dollars more than other products but very well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: snert

customer_reviews.title: Overall I love it.
customer_reviews.text: A little difficult assembling it, instructions weren't quite as clear as they should be as far as steps goes. Overall I love it.
customer_reviews.author: vinny

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: I really love it, very sturdy. I'm and construction and use it for my miter saw
customer_reviews.author: Doyle Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have if you want to move around your mitre or table saw.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gleisner

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Took about an hour to assemble, but has smooth operation
customer_reviews.author: Elly C.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding miter saw stand
customer_reviews.text: Costs more than my Kobalt miter saw, but well worth it. Extremely well made and easy to use mechanism. Being able to keep the saw on the stand even when folded is an invaluable time saver. I could do without the pneumatic tires, but as long as they don't go flat they're fine.
customer_reviews.author: Oroso

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Nothing disappoints in this product. I paired it with the Bosch Glide 12" miter saw and am very satisfied. The only way i see that it could be improved is if it had a gurney function that would facilitate loading it (unassisted) in your truck...Bosch are you listening?
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: you will love it. Easier to use then the other models
customer_reviews.text: Buy it, you will love it. Easier to use then the other models. Does most of the work for you. I bought it because it was about $150 cheaper then any box stores. Use it with my 12" Bosch miter saw.
customer_reviews.author: Hello

customer_reviews.title: THE STAND IS SUPER GREAT. THE STAND IS WELL BUILDED AND DOES ...
customer_reviews.text: THE STAND IS SUPER GREAT. THE STAND IS WELL BUILDED AND DOES MORE THAN I EXPECTED. PEOPLE THAT HAVE A MITER SAW NEED THIS STAND. YOU WILL WONDER WHY I DID NOT BUY ONE SOONER. THE STAND MAKES GOING ON JOBS A SNAP.MARTIN
customer_reviews.author: Martin dugas

customer_reviews.title: Bosch Miter Saw Stand
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something I could navigate stairs and load in the truck by myself, without disassembly. This unit has met and exceeded my expectations. I was amazed at how well balanced it is. The saw separates from the base easily and quickly. The table extensions are adequate for supporting work. I do have a recommendation for improvement. Place some type of protective cover over areas of the stand that contact the floor when raising or lowering.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Martin

customer_reviews.title: easy to use, accurate and able to handle long boards
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to fold up not so easy to set up for use.
customer_reviews.author: ken gile

customer_reviews.title: Amazing stand.
customer_reviews.text: Really is worth the money for how convenient it is. Would but again in a instant.
customer_reviews.author: G. Selgrath

customer_reviews.title: Great stand for our saw!!
customer_reviews.text: Was a gift for hubby & he loves it. His saw fit perfectly & the unit folds down nicely to fit in most places. Glad we got this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Sue B.

customer_reviews.title: Bosch stand is very well built.
customer_reviews.text: Stand was easy to put together.Stand is very easy to fold and unfold.Stand is very sturdy and was easy to mount saw on.
customer_reviews.author: David Lewis

product_meta.title: BOSCH Portable Gravity-Rise Wheeled Miter Saw Stand T4B
product_meta.description:
Bosch expanded Its patented and award-winning technology to develop and introduce the new Gravity-Rise T4B portable Miter saw stand. Smart, durable and simple to use, professionals never need to worry about how to setup or carry their Miter saw ever again. The T4B features the same bosch-patented Gravity-Rise system as the industry's award winning TS2000 Gravity-Rise Table saw stand. Unlike other Miter saw stands, the Bosch Gravity-Rise system is practically effortless and allows for Rapid set-up.

AMAZON.COM
The Bosch TB4 gravity-rise miter saw stand features the patented gravity rise system, and rapid set up and breakdown. It has an 18-inch material capacity which is the highest capacity among fully portable units. It has 8-inch pneumatic wheels which facilitate ease of transport over jobsite terrain. It also features rapid release tool mounts, adjustable leveling feet for stability on uneven surfaces and it also fits most competitors' miter saws.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Bosch expanded its patented and award-winning technology to develop and introduce the new Gravity-Rise T4B Portable Miter Saw Stand. Smart, durable and simple to use, professionals never need to worry about how to setup or carry their miter saw ever again. The T4B features the same Bosch-patented Gravity-Rise system as the industry's award winning TS2000 Gravity-Rise Table Saw Stand. Unlike other miter saw stands, the Bosch Gravity-Rise system is practically effortless and allows for rapid set-up and breakdown in seconds. With a simple turn of the release lever and the user's guidance, the weight and balance smoothly raises the heavy-gauge steel and aluminum constructed stand and saw into working position. Set the leveling-Feet for uneven terrain and professionals are ready to get to work. Turn the same release lever again and the entire stand folds into a push cart design, complete with 8-Inch pneumatic wheels, perfect for transporting the saw over rough terrain from one location to the next. The T4B utilizes an aluminum support rail and special Universal Rapid-Release Tool Mounts designed to attach to the base of all Bosch and most competitors' miter saws. These mounts allow any user to quickly attach or detach the saw to the stand. And rubber-Feet prevent scratches when placing the tool on a cabinet top or bench. The same support rails expand for 18-Feet total material support, the highest among fully portable units. For users cutting long pieces of molding or flooring, this kind of support is priceless. Adjustable repetitive stops and table supports also allow the stand to adapt to varying applications and saws.

See more
feature_bullets: ADJUSTABLE: Featuring a Bosch-exclusive, patented Gravity Rise System designed for rapid set up and easy breakdown, taking the toughest jobs to the next level
CAPACITY: The Bosch T4B Gravity-Rise Miter saw stand has up to 18 feet of material capacity, the highest capacity among fully portable units
PORTABLE: Built with 8-Inch pneumatic wheels for ease of transport over jobsite terrain with even the heaviest miter saws attached
UNIVERSAL: Featuring Rapid Release tool mounts - for use with most major competitors miter saws. Adjustable out feed -up to 12 inch in height
DURABLE: Equipped with adjustable leveling feet for stability and durability on uneven surfaces. Material - Steel
